definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: The closer the relative, the more the pattern of repeats matches.
sentences.chinese: 血缘关系越近，这些重复的模式越相近。

sentences.english: There is no kinship between them, but they two are very close.
sentences.chinese: 他们两人虽没有血缘关系，但却亲如胶漆。

sentences.english: The family of Abraham is based upon faith and not fleshly descent.
sentences.chinese: 这是建于信而非血缘关系的基础上的。

sentences.english: The Indian organ transplantation rules bar government hospitals from conducting kidney transplants if the donor has no blood relation to the patient.
sentences.chinese: 器官移植法禁止政府医院为没血缘关系人士移植肾脏。

sentences.english: We're not related but we can be something else.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有血缘关系，但我们可以有别的。

sentences.english: Every female within the pride is usually related.
sentences.chinese: 狮群中的母狮凡是是有血缘关系的。

sentences.english: It's a kind of simulation to the consanguinity obviously.
sentences.chinese: 从其字面上看，它明显就是血缘关系的一种模拟。

sentences.english: Even if animals are unrelated, they are nice to one another.
sentences.chinese: 即使没有血缘关系的动物，它们也会友善地对待对方。

sentences.english: The prosperity of the people with a surname of Lee in Longxi has consanguinity with the development of the ancient Qiang nationality.
sentences.chinese: 陇西李氏之兴，与古羌族的发展有密切的血缘关系。

definition: (of siblings) having the same mother but different fathers/half (brother or sister)
(of siblings) having the same father but different mothers/half (brother or sister)
one's own (child) (i.e. one's child by birth)/biological (parents)/birth (parents)
blood is thicker than water/fig. family ties are closer than social relations
